sensehubr 0.1.0
  • Reference

Global analysis of sensory data

Source: R/analyse-global.R
analyse_global.Rd

Perform global analysis on sensory table.

analyse_global(.data, ...)

Arguments

.data

a sensory table
...

other arguments to pass on specific method

Examples

data(perfume_qda_consumers)
(df <- specify(
  .data = perfume_qda_consumers,
  sensory_method = "QDA",
  panelist = consumer,
  product = product,
  attribute = intensity:green,
  hedonic = NULL
))
#> # A sensory table: <1236 x 23>
#> # Sensory method:  Quantitative Descriptive Analysis
#> # Panelist:        consumer <103 subjects>
#> # Product:         product <12 items>
#> # Attribute:       intensity, freshness, jasmin, ro...<21 lexicons>
#> # Hedonic:         None
#>    consumer product intensity freshness jasmin  rose camomille fresh_lemon
#>    <fct>    <fct>       <dbl>     <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>       <dbl>

analyse_global(df)

# Using pipe %>%
data(perfume_qda_experts)
perfume_qda_experts %>%
  specify(
    sensory_method = "QDA",
    panelist = panelist,
    product = product,
    session = session,
    pres_order = rank,
    attribute = spicy:wrapping
  ) %>%
  analyse_global()
#> # Global analysis:       
#> # Sensory method:         Quantitative Descriptive Analysis
#> # Method:                 Principal Component Analysis
#> # Active individual:      12 items
#> # Active variable:        12 lexicons
